As there are 2 switches one can ON the switch from ground floor while entering the staircase and OFF the switch from first floor while exiting the staircase.  This Project makes it easy for users to operate bulbs in staircases.
Consider the below 2-way switch wiring diagram which has been used to control a bulb in staircase. The schematic shows that circuit is completed and bulb is ON. Suppose you want to OFF the bulb from the upper switch at top of stair  (upper portion of staircase)  simply Switch OFF the switch then circuit will break and the bulb will be OFF. To switch ON the bulb again, just switch ON the same switch at upper portion of staircase. In other words you can OFF and ON bulb from upper switch at the top of stair. Obviously; you can perform the same operation from the bottom switches installed in staircase.

Description:

1.During night the LDR gives a high resistance as a result   the voltage passing through the base will become less than 5V so the LED glows. 
2.During day time LDR gives a low resistance as a result the voltage through base is greater than 5V which switches the current to the emitter. This turns LED off.

Title: ROCK PAPER SCISSOR GAME
Description:
Rock paper Scissor (which is also called Stone Paper Scissor) is a hand game and played between two people, in which each player simultaneously forms one of three shapes .But here we Implement this idea using C language and programming.The winner of the game is decided as per the below rules:
•	Rock vs Paper -> Paper wins.
•	Rock vs Scissor -> Rock wins.
•	Paper vs Scissor -> Scissor wins.

In this game, the user will be asked to make choice and according to the choice of user and computer and then the result will be displayed along with the choices of both computer and user.

Approach towards Implementation

Below is the functionality that needed to be implemented in the program:

main() function: 
It consists of the declaration of the variables.
•	printf() and scanf() functions for displaying the content and taking input from the user. 
•	It also contains two predefined functions:
•	srand() and rand() which are used to generate random numbers in the range [0, RAND_MAX) . The function srand() especially will help to generate a random number at each time.
•	Take modulo of random number generated with 100 to make its range between (0 and 100).
•	As the range is up to 100 only, the distribution among all the options i.e., stone, paper, and scissors is equal as all of them have an equal probability of coming.

game() function: 
This function consists of if-else statements that will compare the choice of user and computer. If the user wins then it will return 1. Otherwise, if the computer wins then it will return 0. If it is a tie, it will return -1.
Subject: PSAP

Title: AUTOMATIC STREET LIGHT USING LDR
Description:
IMPORTANCE OF THE  PROJECT :-
Sometimes due weather or location the the intensity of light changes adruptly.Due this the visibility varies and manually turning light on/off isn’t possible everytime.Automating this system will help lower the use of electricity and lessen the number of accidents occur due to lack of light and visibility.
STEPS TO DO THE PROJECT/ METHODOLGY :-
Here we use transistor as a two way switch. If the voltage through base is greater than 9V it send through the emitter. If the voltage through base is less than 9V the it sends through collector.
During night the LDR gives a high resistance as a result the voltage passing through the base will become less than 9V so the LED glows.
During day time LDR gives a low resistance as a result the voltage through base is greater than 5V which switches the current to the emitter. This turns LED off.
TENTATIVE EXPECTED RESULTS :-

Title: Interlocking of Lamps
Description:
The interlock consists of one or more switches that prevent both main power and generator power from powering the dwelling simultaneously. Without this safeguard, both power sources running at once could cause an overload condition, or generator power back-feed onto the main. An interlock device is designed to allow a generator to provide backup power in such a way that it prevents main and generator power to be connected at the same time.

1.	Understanding the concept and use of interlocking.
2.	Analyzing the hardware components needed and estimating the cost of project.

Title: railway motion detector using 555 timer
Description:
The main motto of this project is to ensure human safety by implenting the use of ic 555 timer 
which will beep the alarm in the upcoming points where there is a probablity of people on railway track so after listening to this beep they can leave the track it is more safer than railway horns as railway horn have range of about 1 km but we can alert people 4-5 km prior using this .
working of the model;
Infrared comes in the place of the electromagnetic spectrum which is not visible to naked eyes. All the hot objects generate these IR radiations and by detecting these radiations, we can sense the motion. The PIR sensor does not emit any IR radiation but only detects the radiations and thus it is called “passive”. On the other hand, we have IR modules that send an IR pulse continuously and when it bounces back from an object, the module can detect it by using a photodiode. This photodiode in this case can only detect Infrared light and not visible light.

Two main components of an IR sensor module are IR LED and photodiode. LED looks exactly like a normal LED but it emits IR instead of the visible colors that we are familiar with. Photodiode is the key component that detects the bounced back radiations.
components required;
555 timer IC
220KΩ resistors*2
100kΩ resistor
1KΩ resistor
1uf electrolytic capacitor
LED
220Ω resistor
SPDT Relay*2
In4007 diode*2
BC547 NPN transistor
BC557 pnp transistor
DC jack
IR sensor module
Subject: RMAE

Title: Rock Paper Scissors
Description:
IMPORTANCE OF THE DECIDED PROJECT (2/3 LINES):-
The familiar game of Rock, Paper, Scissors is played between two people, in which each player simultaneously 
forms one of three symbols. The winner of the game is decided as per the following conditions:
Rock vs Paper -> Paper wins.
Rock vs Scissor -> Rock wins.
Paper vs Scissor -> Scissor wins.
In this game, the user will be asked to choose according to the choice of user and computer and then the result 
will be displayed along with the choices of both computer and user.
STEPS TO DO THE PROJECT/ METHODOLGY (7/8 LINES) :-

RAND_MAX) and srand() helps to generate a random number at every interval. 
4. The range is given such as there is an equal probability for the occurrence of the three options; stone, 
paper, and scissors.
5. game() function: This function consists of if-else statements that will compare the choice between the 
user and the computer. If the user wins it will return 1. If the computer wins then it will return 0. It will 
return -1 if a draw takes place.
TENTATIVE EXPECTED RESULTS FROM THE PROJECT (2/3 LINES):- 
In the output screen, the user will be asked to enter their choice amongst rock, paper, and scissors. When the 
user enters the choice the result will be displayed accordingly
Often, an opponent who discovers your strategy can easily beat you. The computer on another hand simply 
chooses randomly with an equal probability for each option. Even if you could tell the computer's strategy, there 
is no way for you to use this to beat the computer consistently.

Title: Operating bulb using multiway switch.
Description:
In building wiring, multiway switching is the interconnection of two or more electrical switches to control an electrical load from more than one location. A common application is in lighting, where it allows the control of lamps from multiple locations, for example in a hallway, stairwell, or large room.
In contrast to a simple light switch, which is a single pole, single throw (SPST) switch, multiway switching uses switches with one or more additional contacts and two or more wires are run between the switches. When the load is controlled from only two points, single pole, double throw (SPDT) switches are used. Double pole, double throw (DPDT) switches allow control from three or more locations.
In alternative designs, low-voltage relay or electronic controls can be used to switch electrical loads, sometimes without the extra power wires.
Subject: RMAE

Title: Tea Coffee Vending Machine Using 555 Timer
Description:
IMPORTANCE OF THE DECIDED PROJECT:-
A vending machine is useful as it reduces human efforts and saves time. Self-service vending 
machines have a button to press and you have a standard specific-sized glass. You press that 
button & liquid comes from that machine's container for a couple of seconds then stops.
METHODOLOGY OF THE PROJECT:-
We are making a tea coffee vending machine project using the 555 timer ic project. The IC 
555 is set in a monostable state, the control circuit is for an IC555 delay timer circuit. Once 
the Pushbutton is pressed, the button triggers the IC in the counting mode and activates the 
relay.
The relay on getting activated connects to the supply and it controls the flow of liquid 
through it until the counting period is elapsed, and the IC switches OFF the relay.
CONCLUSION:-
The machine created works on the principle of 555 timer ic. It is time-saving and an easy 
innovation. the machine fills the glass with liquid. As it has a desired time set according to 
the time required to fill a particular volume of glass.
Tool: 555 Timer Ic, Resistors , Capacitors 100 Uf, 0.1 Uf Diodes, DC Pump,  Transistor, Push-Button, Connecting Wires and a Breadboard.

Title: Traffic lights using IC 555
Description: In this traffic light circuit by using IC 555 we will be looking toward the working and intermittent of capacitor due to which resulting into on and off of LED lights. The capacitor of 2nd 555 timer IC slowly charges and as soon as it charges to 2/3rd of the supply voltage (Threshold Voltage), the output of 2nd 555 IC turns OFF and the yellow LED glows because the discharge pin is activated. Normally the yellow LED would turn ON for the same time as the green LED. Yellow LED turns ON during discharge mode of second 555 IC and the green LED turns ON whenever the output of 2nd 555 timer IC is at positive voltage.
Tool: Battery, Resistors, Capacitors, LED diode,555 IC timer , Potentiometer, IC counter.
Subject: RMAE

Title: Asynchronous Automatic Electricity Bill Generator
Description:

This will accurately calculate bill amount.
This program can be enhanced to print the bill and email the bill automatically to the customer 
Close to real life product used in electricity board 

This  “asynchronous automatic electricity bill generator” stimulates real life experience by maintaining customer database in a file and the current reading is fetched from a file stored on local hard disc.
Based upon the reading, bill calculator module will calculate the final amount to pay and it will be sent to bill generator module which prints the final bill in a bill format and saves the bill on local hard disk in a file.
This is modular programming. All the modules are independent and they interact with each other with defined interface. 

This program will display the final electricity bill in a file instead of displaying it on command prompt.

Title: Fridge door alarm circuit
Description:
When the door of the refrigerator is left open, the temperature inside the cabin will increase. 
This rise in temperature will be sensed by the thermostat and try to cool down the cabin. It 
will always try to maintain a constant temperature of the system. The compressor will be 
working continuously to remove the heat from the cabin, this increases the power 
consumption from the receptacle. Also, continuous usage under this condition would reduce 
the life of the compressor and probably malfunction. Hence, integrating an alarm circuit helps 
in saving power and prolong the life of the compressor. We plan to use two IC 555 timers; one connected to the LDR and the other controlling the 
beeping alarm. When the refrigerator is opened, the in-built light turns on. This in turn 
reduces the resistance of the LDR which we plan to convert into the time for which the 
resistance was low. If we set a predefined time after which alarm should be triggered, this 
system would work as intended. With our project, we can prolong the lifespan of the refrigerator compressor and help control 
the temperature inside the cabin.

Title: AUTOMATIC STREET LIGHT
Description:
We are  making a simple street light circuit with some simple transistor, resistors and a relay.
 Schematics of Street light circuit project:
The project is all about the energy efficient. This program’s circuit is based upon cheap NPN transistors. We will  use LDR as a Light sensor and a Relay as a switch.
The relay is a digital switch that can handle the maximum current. Here we can also use any type of  Power Mosfets for making the circuit. We are using Relay for making the circuit simple. If the external light falls on LDR then the relay should be turned off. And if the LDR is in Dark then the Relay will be on.it generally the street light circuit project works as here is the simple Schematics of the circuit. The LDR and the 2.2k resistor makes a voltage divider. At first, suppose that the LDR is not capturing the light. Then the Resistance of the LDR will be close to infinite. So, not current will flow from Q1 NPN Transistor. This time current flows from Vcc to Q2 NPN Transistor’s Base through 1k Resistor. It turns on the Q2 Transistor. The Load that is connected with the Q2 Transistor will be turned on. Here we are using light as a light source So, It became turned on. 
In another way, if the LDR Gets light from outside then the Q1 became conductive and all current flows through the shortest path that is VCC to GND 1k Resistor. No current will flow into the Q2 Transistor’s Base. So, Q2 Transistor will not be triggered as well as the Relay. 
 Benefits of street lights:
This means controlling the street ligh  depending on the outside lighting conditions. In the case of thick mist, a solar eclipse or dark clouds that bring a storm, by using sensors, the automatic street lighting system enhances public safety by adjusting the light output in the needed area.
Subject: RMAE

Description:
1) A DC regulated power supply is essentially an unregulated power supply with the addition of a voltage regulator.
2) In our course project we are using ZENER DIODE for making the DC regulated power supply.
3) Zener diode is commonly used as a voltage regulator to maintain a constant DC output voltage.
4) ZENER DIODE maintains voltage throughout power fluctuations and load changes. It can control both AC and DC voltages. Their secondary function is to shield the electric circuit from voltage spikes that could damage or fry it.
5) The Zener diode is less expensive than another diode. This diode can be used in regulate and stabilize the voltage in a circuit. These diodes have a high-performance standard. Control the flowing current.
Keyword: 1.CONSTANT VOLTAGE MODE.  2.CONSTANT CURRENT MODE.  3.RESTRICTED CURRENT PROTECTION MODE.  4.FINE VOLTAGE REGULATOR.

The app allows users to browse a catalog of available laptops, select a device for rental, and complete the transaction through the app. The app also allows the admin to update the inventory and rental prices.The app utilizes a user-friendly interface that allows users to easily search and filter the catalog of laptops by various criteria such as brand, model, and rental price. Once a user has selected a laptop to rent, they can complete the transaction through the app and schedule a pickup or delivery time.

The app also includes an admin panel that allows the admin to update the inventory of available laptops, including adding new devices and removing old ones. The admin can also update the rental prices for each laptop and view a history of past rentals.

The app is built using the Android operating system and the Java programming language, and it utilizes a database to store information about the available laptops and rental transactions. The app can be distributed to users for download and installation via the Google Play Store.

There are different types of sun tracking systems, including single-axis and dual-axis systems. The project would typically involve designing and building the tracking mechanism, and integrating it with existing solar panels. An android application that works like LinkedIn but for daily wages and local jobs would be a platform for connecting local employers with workers looking for daily wage or short-term job opportunities. The application would allow employers to post job listings, specifying the job duties, pay rate, and location. Users looking for work would be able to browse these listings and apply for jobs that match their skills and availability.

The application would also include a feature for workers to create a profile that includes their skills, experience, and availability. Employers would be able to search and filter through these profiles to find workers that match the requirements of their job listings.

The application may also include a feature for workers to rate and review their experience with an employer, and vice versa, this would help to build trust and reputation for both the worker and the employer. 

The app will be designed to be simple and easy to use, with a clean user interface that makes it easy for workers to find the job opportunities they're looking for. The application will be aimed at helping people in low-skilled and informal sector jobs, who are often left out by traditional job search platforms.

PFM often lets users categorize transactions and adds accounts from multiple institutions into a single view. PFM also typically includes data visualizations such as spending trends, budgets, and net worth which helps users get one platform to perform all multiple things related to finance. As customer behaviour and customer needs evolve, so will PFM software and the apps that it powers. and it's similar to quicken and personal capital software.
Personal financial management helps us to manage the finance of our home which includes budgeting, saving, debt management, and other aspects related to personal money whereby an individual can achieve personal goals. Personal financial management is the process of controlling income and organizing expenses through a detailed financial plan. Learning to keep track of money coming in, and tailoring the use of this money to fit expenses provides a systematic way and utilizing income. Personal financial management is a key component to making our money work for us. Personal financial management leads every individual to live a better life.

Title: Speed Control Of Motor Using Potentiometer
Description: In Industry DC motor is widely used for speed control and load characteristics. It’s easy controllability provides effective and precise output. So, application of DC motor is large for commercial purpose. Speed control of DC motor is very crucial in applications where speed and precision is required and correcting signal and to operate the motor at constant speed. The variable speed drives, till a couple of decades back, had various limitations, such as poor efficiencies, larger space, lower speeds, etc. Control over a wide speed range, both below and above the rated speed can be easily achieved. The methods of speed control are simpler and less expensive than those of alternating current motors., this method of speed control of DC motors can be made to be used in industrial applications and other places where speed control plays an important role. The components needed for this project are Arduino UNO, DC motor, Transistor 2N2222, Potentiometer 100k ohm, Capacitor 0.1uF, Breadboard and Jumping Wires. In this circuit, for controlling the speed of DC motor, we use a 100K ohm potentiometer to change the duty cycle of the PWM (Pulse width modulation) signal. 100K ohm potentiometer is connected to the Arduino UNO and the DC motor is connected to the Arduino. The working of Arduino program is very simple, as it reads the voltage. The voltage is varied by using the potentiometer. After doing some necessary calculation the duty cycle is adjusted according to it. PWM is a technique using which we can control the voltage or power. We can use this model in  conveyor belts ,elevators, cranes, ski lifts, extruders and mixers.
Subject: RMAE

Title: File Handling Application Software for Banking System
Description:
Financial benefits: Managing and sending millions of documents such as statements and notifications imply a high cost for financial entities. With appropriate document management software, they will be able to reduce this cost considerably.
Banks save time: Handling paper documents entails using resources for a great number of manual tasks like putting letters in envelopes before sending them by post. Adequate document management software helps save a huge amount of paper and, therefore, allows removing many manual tasks. This way, the bank will be able to take better advantage of resources and assign them to more important tasks thanks to the substantial amount of time it saves.
Customers save time: With agile document management software, banks will be able to provide their customers with all their account information in a fast and efficient manner. Thus, customers will have the possibility of accessing this information through the Internet, which will significantly reduce waiting times and, therefore, increase customer satisfaction. Likewise, customers will be able to electronically sign different types of bank documents, which once again results in time and money savings for customers.
Regulations: All banks must comply with legal regulations and keep up with the continuous changes that occur in this field. Nevertheless, this may turn out to be hard when most documents are in paper form and compliance with those regulations is monitored manually. Secure document management software meets all these requirements by efficiently protecting customer data.
Optimized work flow: When documents are managed electronically, it is more agile and efficient to assign each work flow, since employees can easily find the documents and information they need, while complying with working protocols and procedures.
Environmental benefits: Changing to an electronic document management system also involves obvious benefits for the environment. Paper consumption is outstandingly reduced, which implies a decline in tree felling, waste and chemical scrap products.
Subject: PSAP

Title: Servo Motor Control Using IC555
Description:
Servo motors are controlled by using a PWM (Pulse Width Modulated) signal as their input.  
The position of the servo arm depends on the width of ON time (High pulse) of the input PWM signal. Generally, if we set the width of ON time to 1ms, the servo arm moves to 0 degree position. If we set the width of ON time to 3ms, the servo arm moves to 180 degree position. The width of OFF time (Low Pulse) is maintained constant at around 18ms.
In this circuit, 56K & 10k are used to alternate between two ON pulse widths corresponding to 0 degrees and 180 degrees. So clicking one button moves the servo arm to 0 degrees and the other moves the servo arm to 180 degrees.
Subject: RMAE

Title: Gas Leakage Detector
Description:
A gas detector is a device that detects the presence of gases in an area, often as part of a safety system. A gas detector can sound an alarm to operators in the area where the leak is occurring, giving them the opportunity to leave. This type of device is important because there are many gases that can be harmful to organic life, such as humans or animals.

Gas detectors can be used to detect combustible, flammable and toxic gases, and oxygen depletion. This type of device is used widely in industry and can be found in locations, such as on oil rigs, to monitor manufacturing processes and emerging technologies such as photovoltaic. They may be used in firefighting.

Title: Adjustable Flashing Blinking/ LED Circuit Using 555 Timer IC
Description:
Group 4 RMAE Course Project


Project Topic:
Adjustable Flashing/Blinking LED Circuit using 555 Timer IC

Group Members:
1)	Ahmad Ali(19)
2)	Mayank Ahuja(20)
3)	Durva Ajgaonkar(21)
4)	Akash Chimkar(22)
5)	Akshaj Kant(23)
                          
Synopsis
555 timer IC is used to create time difference in various applications. The Blinking LED circuit uses a 555 timer in astable mode, which generates a continuous output in the form of a square wave at pin 3. This waveform will turn LED ON and OFF. The duration of ON/ OFF depends on the time cycle of the square wave. We can change the speed of blinking by changing the value of capacitance.


Applications
In turning indicator circuits of all types of vehicles and cycles
In Strobe lights / SoS signalling circuits (To signal that someone is in danger or needs help)
To control wiper motors and create to and fro motion
In Light indicators used in cars (The relay version of the flashing LED circuit is used)
As an input for applications that require timing pulses. E.g: In counter circuits using 4017 & 4026 ICs
Subject: RMAE

Title: AUTOMATIC STREET LIGHT USING LDR
Description:
Automatic street lights using LDRs can help conserve energy by only turning on when needed and turning off when there is enough ambient light. By reducing energy consumption, automatic street lights using LDRs can help save money on electricity bills. Automatic street lights using LDRs can reduce light pollution by ensuring that the lights are only on when necessary.

STEPS TO DO THE PROJECT/ METHODOLGY (7/8 LINES): -
1. Gather materials: LDR sensor, microcontroller (such as Arduino), LED light, and necessary wiring.
2.Connect the LDR sensor to the microcontroller to measure the level of ambient light.
3. Write a program for the microcontroller to interpret the LDR sensor data and control the LED light.
4. Set the threshold for the LDR sensor to determine when the LED light should turn on and off.
5. Test the circuit and program to ensure proper functionality.
6. Assemble the circuit into a street light housing and mount it in the desired location.
7. Connect the circuit to a power source, such as a solar panel or electrical grid.
8. Test the street light to ensure it turns on and off as desired based on ambient light levels.
TENTATIVE EXPECTED RESULTS FROM THE PROJECT (2/3LINES):
LED street light will turn on automatically when the ambient light level detected by the LDR sensor drops below a certain threshold. The LED street light will turn off automatically when the ambient light level detected by the LDR sensor rises above the same threshold. The project will result in energy savings by reducing the need for manual control of the street light and by not having the light on when it is not needed.
Subject: RMAE

Title: Digital Clock
Description:
The project for our programming class is to create a digital clock using the C programming language. 
The clock will be a graphical application that runs on a computer or other device with a display. The visual aspect of the clock will be implemented using C graphics libraries.
The clock will have a simple and intuitive user interface, allowing users to easily read the time and set the clock if necessary. The clock will display the current time in a digital format, including the hours, minutes, and seconds. The clock will also have the ability to switch between a 12-hour and 24-hour display format.
In order to accurately display the current time, the clock will use the system time and date functions provided by the C standard library. These functions will be used to retrieve the current time and date from the system clock and then display it on the screen.
The clock will be developed using an object-oriented programming approach. The clock will be broken down into several classes, such as Clock, Time, Date, and Alarm, each with its own set of functions and properties. This will make the code more organized and easier to understand and maintain.
Overall, this project aims to provide a functional and visually appealing digital clock application that utilizes the power of the C programming language and C graphics libraries. The project will provide an opportunity for students to learn about graphics programming, system time and date functions, and object-oriented programming concepts in C.
Subject: PSAP

Title: Snake Game
Description:
A snake game is a classic arcade game where the player controls a snake that moves around the screen, typically in a grid-like environment. The goal of the game is to guide the snake to eat food items, which causes the snake to grow in length. The player must avoid running into the walls or the snake's own tail, as this will result in game over.

The game typically starts with a small snake and a few food items on the screen. As the snake eats the food, it grows in length and the player must navigate the increasingly larger snake through the environment. The game becomes more challenging as the snake grows, as the player must be more careful to avoid running into the walls or the snake's tail.
Subject: PSAP

Title: Pick and Place Robot
Description:
A pick and place robot with wheels is a type of mobile robot that is designed to move around a workspace and pick up and move objects from one location to another. This robot consists of a robotic arm and gripper or end effector mounted on a mobile base, which is equipped with wheels for mobility.
The robotic arm is composed of multiple segments or joints, which are controlled by motors to provide precise movement and positioning. The gripper or end effector, is the part of the robot that is responsible for picking up and holding objects. It is a simple mechanical gripper which works on 3 BO motors.
The mobile base of the robot is equipped with a pair of omnidirectional wheels, which are equipped with DC motors which provide power and control for the wheels' movement. The wheels allow the robot to move in any direction, giving it great maneuverability and flexibility in the workspace.
Pick and place robots with wheels are commonly used in a variety of applications, including manufacturing, packaging, and assembly operations. They can help to increase efficiency and reduce the risk of human error by automating repetitive tasks, such as loading and unloading materials, moving parts from one location to another, and assembling products.
Overall, pick and place robots with wheels are versatile and flexible machines that can help to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and increase productivity in a wide range of industrial and manufacturing applications.
Tool: Wheels, chassis, ESP32, DC motors, BO motors, wires, Arduino IDE
Subject: RMAE

Title: Fundamental Calculator
Description:
The android application is a fundamental calculator, coded in the Java programming language. 
The app is designed to perform basic mathematical operations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. 
It enables users to perform basic operations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division on their phone. Being installed on the phone, it always remains with the user, helping with daily life calculations and working as a typical android calculator app.
The user interface is simple and intuitive, making it easy for users to perform calculations quickly and efficiently.
Upon opening the app, the user is presented with a clean and minimalistic layout, displaying the calculator's main functions on the screen. The user can input numbers using the on-screen keypad, and select the appropriate mathematical operation using the corresponding buttons. 
Once the calculation is complete, the result is displayed on the screen in a clear and easy-to read format.
The app supports both basic and advanced mathematical operations, such as the ability to perform calculations with decimals and negative numbers.
Overall, the android application is a powerful and user-friendly calculator that is perfect for students, professionals, and anyone who needs to perform quick and accurate calculations on the go. It is an ideal app for anyone looking for a simple and efficient tool to help them with their mathematical calculations.
Android applications are the most compatible and easily available, making android cell 
phones and tablets the most widely used devices all over the world. They offer several kinds of facilities, and one of them is a calculator, which is a fundamental application of each phone. 
Looking at the growing use of android phones, it can be said that a calculator app as an android project has good scope in today's technological world.
The app allows the user to perform fundamental mathematical operations, and gives fast and accurate results. Additionally, it consumes very little power of your cell phone. The software requirement for this app is Android Studio version 3.3 or later.

Title: Flip-Flop Circuit using Transistor
Description:
	A flip-flop is a type of digital circuit that has two stable states and can be used to store binary data. The two states are often represented by the voltage levels of a signal, one state being "high" (1) and the other being "low" (0). 
	Flip-flops are the basic building blocks of digital circuits and are used in a wide variety of applications, including computer memory, digital counters, and data storage devices. They are also used in synchronous digital circuits to synchronize the transfer of data between different parts of a circuit.

Title: To-do list
Description:
•	A simple to-do list application is a software program designed to help users keep track of tasks they need to complete. These tasks can range from small, everyday tasks such as grocery shopping or paying bills, to larger, more complex projects like planning a wedding or remodelling a house.
•	The basic functionality of a simple to-do list application includes the ability to create new tasks, edit existing tasks, and mark tasks as complete. Users can also typically set reminders for tasks and organize them into different categories or lists.
•	One of the key features of a simple to-do list application is its user-friendly interface. The interface should be easy to navigate and understand, with clear and concise instructions on how to use the various features.
•	Another important feature is the ability to sync the to-do list across multiple devices. This allows users to access and update their to-do list from their phone, tablet, or computer, ensuring that they always have the most up-to-date information.
•	Many simple to-do list applications also include additional features such as the ability to collaborate with others, share lists, and set task priorities. Some also offer integrations with other productivity tools such as calendars and email.
•	Overall, a simple to-do list application is a useful tool for anyone looking to stay organized and on top of their tasks. Whether you're a busy professional, a student, or a stay-at-home parent, a good to-do list app can help you stay on track and achieve your goals.

Title: Automatic Street Light Using LDR
Description:
Importance - 
The automatic operation of street light controlling systems help to reduce the energy consumption as compared to the manually operated street light controlling operations.They have lower maintenance cost, as compared to the normal lighting system. They also contribute in enhancing public safety.

Methodology - 

Components Required - 
LDR - Light Dependent Resistor.
2 Nos. of transistors. (NPN transistor – BC547 or BC147 or BC548)
Resistor- 1kΩ, 100kΩ, 330 Ohm & 470 ohms.
Light emitting diode (LED) – Any colour.
Connecting wires – ( single-core plastic-coated wire of 0.6mm diameter (the standard size) or any wire used in computer networking).
Power supply-6V.
The steps and methodology involved in the project development is as follows – 
1.	Insert first transistor Q1-BC547 (NPN) on breadboard (or general PCB).
2.	Connect another transistor Q2- BC547 (NPN) on the breadboard.
3.	Connect wires across the emitter pin of both transistors and negative terminal of battery (lowest/bottom row of breadboard.)
4.	Connect a wire across the Collector pin of transistor Q1 and Base pin of transistor Q2.
5.	Connect a resistor 1K across the positive terminal of battery (topmost row of breadboard) and Collector pin of transistor Q1.
6.	Connect Light Dependent Resistor (LDR) across the positive terminal of battery (topmost row of breadboard) and base terminal of transistor Q1.
7.	Insert a resistor- 330 Ohm across base pin of transistor Q1 and negative terminal of battery (lowest bottom row of breadboard).
8.	Connect a resistor 330R across the positive terminal of battery (topmost row of breadboard) and anode terminal of LED (Light emitting diode) & Connect the cathode terminal of LED to Collector pin of transistor Q2.

Expected Results - 
The LDR circuit must be able to detect external brightness, provide the input as per the brightness level. If the brightness level is low, the circuit must turn the LED lights on automatically and switch off when the brightness level increases.
Tool: Light Dependent Resistor ( LDR ), Transistors, Light Emitting Diodes ( LED )
Subject: RMAE

Title: Obstacle detection system for vehicle
Description: The trajectory of a vehicle is comprehensively affected by the interactions between the vehicle, the driving behavior, and the road environment. We are trying to develop an system which will reduce High-risk driving behaviors and accidents on accident-prone roads  by identifying the relationship between the trajectory and road geometry. Previous related studies mostly focused on the trajectory deviation at a few points on the road, which cannot capture the continuous variation of the trajectory in an entire curve and as it gets difficult to detect the oppositely coming vehicle. To solve that problem we are going to set sensors at one end of curvy path when a vehicle comes in the radius of the sensor it will give signals at the other end of the path so if there's an vehicle coming in the opposite direction, its driver will a alert and he/she will drive safely, reducing the risks of accidents.
Subject: RMAE

Title: Unbiased Electronic Dice with LEDs  ( degi dice)
Description:
SYNOPSIS
IMPORTANCE OF THE DECIDED PROJECT (2/3 LINES):-		
Playing with dice needs us to pick up a dice and make sure that it is unbiased.. The dice becomes biased if the shape is not cut well. Also, the dice can become biased due to deformations. If it is a wooden die, it can deform due to dampness in the atmosphere or due to mechanical stress. To solve all these problems which we have with a conventional dice, we have made a dice circuit which solves all the problems of a conventional dice.


STEPS TO DO THE PROJECT/ METHODOLGY (7/8 LINES):-
1.	In this digital dice circuit we have used 6 LEDs, each LED represent a number (1-6) of Dice. LEDs start flashing as we press the Push button and stops when we release it. 
2.	After release, illuminated LED tells the numbers, you got on Dice. Like if fifth no. LED remains ON after releasing the button, means you got 5 on Dice. 
3.	We have connected 6 LEDs to the output Q0 to Q5, and the seventh output Q6 is connected back to the RESET PIN 15. So that after LED 6 it starts from the First LED at Q0.o apply the clock pulse at PIN 14 of 4017 IC, we have used 555 timer IC in Astable mode .
4.	In this digital dice circuit we have kept the oscillation frequency so high that no one can cheat.
5.	 LED flashing speed is directly proportional to oscillation frequency of 555, as High the frequency, as high the speed of flashing. 

TENTATIVE EXPECTED RESULTS FROM THE PROJECT (2/3 LINES):-                     
There is no chance to cheat as the circuit operates at such a high speed that the circuit is almost imperceptible to the human eye. There is also little maintenance and there is hardly any impact on aging of the circuit. The frequency may vary a bit with change in power supply voltage, aging of the active and passive components but still the randomness will be preserved without any trouble.
Tool: •	LEDs X 6 •	555 Timer IC •	CD4017 Decade Counter IC •	Resistors – 2.2KΩ, 100KΩ X 2 •	Capacitors – 1nF and 0.1µF •	Push Button •	9V Battery •	Breadboard •	Connecting Wires
Subject: RMAE

Title: Unit Converter
Description:
Unit converter is a code used for conversion of units. It converts units from one system of measurement to another. Unit converter uses the following steps:
1. Convert the number to the corresponding unit. 
2. Compare the units of the converted number and the original number. If the difference between the two are less than a certain threshold then it means the conversion was successful. 
3. The converted unit is displayed on the screen.
4. A new number with the same unit can be converted. 
5. Repeat the above steps for the next unit until the unit conversion is complete. 
6. To convert the whole number, press the space bar and type the number.

Title: Pick and place bot
Description: Our pick and place robot equipped with wheels is a custom-built machine designed for our course project in robotics. As the name suggests, it is designed to pick up and move objects from one location to another using a combination of a robotic arm, simple mechanical gripper and a mobile base equipped with wheels for mobility. The robotic arm is the key component of the robot that is responsible for moving objects around the workspace. It is made up of multiple segments or joints that are controlled by 3 BO motors to provide precise movement and positioning. The arm is also equipped with sensors and encoders that allow the robot to determine its position and orientation, as well as to detect any obstacles in its path. This allows the robot to move objects with great precision, even in complex or cluttered workspaces. The gripper or end effector is the component that is responsible for picking up and holding objects. It is a simple mechanical gripper which works on 3 BO motors. It uses a set of jaws or fingers to grip objects and hold them in place. The gripper is designed to be versatile and can handle a wide range of different types of objects, making it suitable for a variety of applications. The mobile base of the robot is equipped with wheels, which allow it to move around the workspace. The wheels are equipped with DC motors which provide power and control for the wheels' movement. The wheels allow the robot to move in any direction, giving it great maneuverability and flexibility in the workspace. One of the notable features of our robot is its simplicity, it does not include any additional features such as vision systems or sensors. Despite this, it is still a highly capable machine that is well-suited for a wide range of industrial and manufacturing applications. It can help to increase efficiency and reduce the risk of human error by automating repetitive tasks such as loading and unloading materials, moving parts from one location to another, and assembling products. Overall, our pick and place robot is a custom-built machine designed specifically for our course project in robotics class. It is a sophisticated machine that requires a lot of planning and attention to details to build. We believe that this robot will be a great learning tool for our class and a valuable addition to any manufacturing or assembly operation.
Subject: RMAE

Description: The hangman game is developed using C programming language. This game in c programming is about guessing letters (A-Z) to form the words. This game is played between two persons where the first person will enter any random word depending upon his/her choice and the second player needs to guess it under certain number of chances. First player will provide some hints for the same. This game ends after a certain number of incorrect guesses, and the player loses. Also, the conditional statements are used to check the player’s guess is correct/incorrect. In this, arrays and strings are use for traversing each element of the input word as well as the guessed letters entered by the user. Also, C graphics are used to make it attractive. Title: Water Level Indicator
Description: Day to day the drinking water crisis is increasing all over the world. It might very soon become a big problem. Therefore, it is very important for all of us to conserve water. In this modern-day, every house, building, office, and industry are using overhead water tanks, that fulfil they are daily using water demands. The overflow is a common problem for all of us that wastage lots of water. In this project, we will make a simple electronic circuit called ‘Water Level Indicator’ using water sensor with three levels that consist of inside a tank with the help of 3 LED and a buzzer to indicate that the tank is full to solve this problem. We know that water conducts electricity, the Water level indicator works upon this fact. The water/liquid level indicator is a system that continuously monitors the water/liquid level in a reservoir, tank, or any other container, and gives us the correct information about the water/liquid level. When the water level increase in the tank, then one by one the 3 Metal Contacts connected to input pins will create contact with the common Contact point through the water. In this way, the input pins of the IC get high input voltage and the respective output pins of the IC become LOW (ground), which turns on the LEDs. The 3 LED’s are used as an indicator that indicates the water level inside the tank. The buzzer is used for alarm, when the tank becomes full it generates a loud sound that tells us to turn off the pump.
Subject: RMAE

Title: Water Tank Level Control using IC 555 Timer
Description: A water tank level controller using an IC 555 timer is a simple circuit that uses the IC 555 timer to automatically control the water level in a tank. You just have to complete the circuit and place the wires inside the tank at different positions. When you start the water pump to fill the water tank the circuit will activate automatically. It will check if the level of the water inside the tank is full or not, by means of wires that we place inside the tank. If the water level is low or moderate the pump will continue working and when the water level is full the circuit will cut the supply of the water pump and turn it off.

Title: Servo Motor Controller Using IC555
Description:
Servo motors are employed in variety of applications like Robotics,Industries,Computers,Doors,Toys and much more. But unlike generic DC motor we can control the angle of Servo motor. This gives more precise movements using this motor.
The Servo controller is the link between the Servo motor and a high-level control (PLC or programmable logic controller). It adapts the original signal and forwards it to the motor. The controller therefore gets extremely precise control of position, speed and torque.
Tool: ZERO PCB ,MICRO PUSH SWITCH ,8 PIN IC BASE, RESISITORS, CAPACITOR ,TRANSISTOR ,MALE HEADER PIN, NE555 IC ,SERVO MOTOR, INPUT VOLTAGE

Title: CGPA Calculator in C language
Description:
A CGPA (Cumulative Grade Point Average) calculator is a software program that calculates the overall academic performance of a student based on the grades they have received in multiple courses.
The project would include the following features:
Ability to input the number of courses taken by a student
Ability to input the grades and credits for each course
Ability to calculate the CGPA based on the grades and credits inputted
Ability to display the calculated CGPA
The program will be written in the C programming language and will use basic mathematical operations, such as addition and division, to calculate the CGPA. The program will also use loops and conditional statements to allow the user to input multiple courses and their grades.
Overall, the project aims to create a simple and user-friendly CGPA calculator that can be used by students to easily track their academic performance.
Subject: PSAP

The application also allows users to save their course information for future reference and track their progress over time. The application will be compatible with Android platforms.
Overall, the project aims to create a simple and user-friendly CGPA calculator that can be used by students to easily track their academic performance.

Title: LIBRARY MANAGEMENT SYSTEM
Description:
The concept of storing or recording the details of books embedded within the user's system is known as Library Management System. It details the type of books, the list of books, etc. Only a person with the login credentials can access the Library Management System. That person can perform many operations like adding the book details, removing the book details, displaying the book details, modifying the book details, etc.  
We must use the Library Management System in order to have secured storage of book details contained within the Library ( probably ). This feature is generally enabled in order to protect the data, which is highly confidential. This is one of the simplest Management systems built within the system using the C programming language.  
The Library Management System overviews the concept of storing and generating all the data or records of the book contained within the library. This can be known as a general database which stores the data of the book details. It helps in searching the details by reducing time consumption. Not only protects the details of the books in the library but also saves all the data up to date without missing any. This is the major benefit of the Library Management System.  
We will construct a C program to perform the operations such as " Adding the book details ", " Displaying the book details ", and " Finding the total number of books in the library ".
Subject: PSAP

Title: Stopwatch
Description:
The stopwatch is basically a timepiece that is designed particularly to measure the time elapsed between the activation and deactivation of the stopwatch. The users can start the Stopwatch and stop it anytime.  
The Stopwatch Application will have:  
1.	A display that will show the time on it. For the display, we have used TextView  
2.	Three options, using the User Interface components that are Buttons:  
•	Start Button: The start is the activation for the Stopwatch. It will activate the Stopwatch as soon as pressed.  
•	Stop Button: The Stop button will be used to deactivate the stopwatch. As soon as we click the stop button the stopwatch will be deactivated. After getting deactivated it will show the total time elapsed between the activation and deactivation of the watch.  
•	Reset Button: The reset button is used to set the stopwatch to 00:00:00 again. Stopwatch needs to be reset once its use is done.
Subject: MAD
